Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  His Grace Bishop Andonios of the Greek Orthodox Diocese of America.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER VALLONE.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by His Grace Bishop Andonios of the Greel Othodox Archdiocese of America.

Council Member Vallone Jr. moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to health insurance coverage for the surviving spouse or domestic partner and children of deceased city employees whose death is the natural and proximate result of an accident or injury sustained while in the performance of duty.
Items.MatterName: Health insurance coverage for the surviving spouse or domestic partner and children of deceased city employees.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the resale of undergarments.
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the resale of undergarments.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Governor George Pataki and the New York State Legislature to adequately fund the City University of New York so as to return it to a tuition-free system.
Items.MatterName: Adequately fund CUNY so as to return it to a tuition-free system.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Sampson, S.4347-B, and Committee on Rules, A.8433-A, “AN ACT to amend chapter 341 of the laws of 2002, relating to authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner Richard Bothwell, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 3868, Lots No. 20 and 22 on tax map for the borough of Brooklyn also known as 891-895 Mother Gaston Boulevard in the borough of Brooklyn, in relation to identifying the correct former owner of such real property as Carol Ajoku”.
Items.MatterName: In rem, Carol Ajoku, Brooklyn (S.4347-B, A.8433-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Sampson, S.4997-A, and Assembly Members Gordon, O’Donnell and Ortiz, et al, A.6879-A, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to the former owner Elva McZeal Tenants Association Housing Development Fund Corporation notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 3785, Lot Nos. 1 and 75 on the tax map for the borough of Brooklyn”.
Items.MatterName: In rem, Elva McZeal, Brooklyn (S.4997-A, A.6879-A)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon New York State to conduct and fund an annual study showing how much tax revenue is generated by residents and workers in each county or City and subsequently sent to the State Government, and how much each county or city receives from the State in the form of state aid, with an explanation for each discrepancy in the cases in which counties or cities receive less in state aid than they produce for the State in tax revenues together with a plan for correcting such discrepancies.
Items.MatterName: Annual study showing how much tax revenue is generated by residents and workers in each county or City.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to collective bargaining rights of certain city employees.
Items.MatterName: Collective bargaining rights of certain city employees.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the charter of the city of New York, in relation to the preparation and maintenance of a citywide prequalified vendors list.
Items.MatterName: Prequalified vendors list, Preparation & Maintenance

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to hiring on construction projects funded by the city.
Items.MatterName: Construction Project Hiring

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to damages for delay clauses in public contracts.
Items.MatterName: Public Contracts, Damages For Delay

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to adding information on minority- and woman-owned business enterprises to the City’s contract database.
Items.MatterName: Minority and Woman-Owned Business Contract Database

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to disallowing participants in the Campaign Finance Program from making payments to family members.
Items.MatterName: Disallowing participants in the Campaign Finance Program from making payments to family members.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Congress of the United States of America to enact legislation that requires criminal background checks on all applicants for flight instruction, pilot licenses and the renewal of a pilot license and to reject such applications if a felony conviction is revealed.
Items.MatterName: Require criminal background checks on all applicants for flight instruction, pilot licenses and the renewal of a pilot license.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to enact a “Second Chance” rehabilitation program of civic service, education and job training to assist non-violent felony offenders in reintegrating successfully into society.
Items.MatterName: Second chance rehabilitation program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the pre-qualification of bidders for public works contracts.
Items.MatterName: Pre-qualification of bidders for public works contracts.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to fire safety in places of public assembly.
Items.MatterName: Fire safety in places of public assembly

Items.Title: Resolution approving the filing of an application for an amendment to the text of the Zoning Resolution by the Land Use Committee of the Council pursuant to Sections 200 and 201 of the Charter.
Items.MatterName: Approving the filing of an application for an amendment to the text of the Zoning Resolution.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the issuance of building permits for areas in which a rezoning application is pending.
Items.MatterName: Issuance of building permits for areas in which a rezoning application is pending.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the President and the Congress of the United States to allocate additional funding towards raising awareness of Hepatitis B and finding a cure for this disease.
Items.MatterName: Allocate additional funding towards raising awareness of Hepatitis B.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Government to initiate an immediate inquiry into the handling of the case of United States Army Chaplain, Captain James Y. Yee.
Items.MatterName: Inquiry into the handling of the case of United States Army Chaplain, Captain James Y. Yee.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a program to reinvest the proceeds of motion picture and television productions conducted in the city of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Program to reinvest the proceeds of motion picture and television productions in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution decrying the sexual violence and killing of women in Ciudad Juarez, Mexico over the past ten years, calling upon the Comptroller of the City of New York to develop and enforce procedures, short of disinvestment, that ensure that corporations receiving New York City pension funds respect the basic human rights of their employees and calling on the appropriate authorities in Mexico to take steps to end the killings in Ciudad Juarez.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Decrying the sexual violence and killing of women in Ciudad Juarez, Mexico

Items.Title: Resolution supporting comprehensive programs for the diagnosis and treatment of Hepatitis C, and educational efforts for substance abusers and persons with psychiatric disabilities who are substance abusers in order to stem the current epidemic of Hepatitis C infections.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Supporting comprehensive programs for the diagnosis and treatment of Hepatitis C.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Congressional Delegation to oppose President Bush’s proposal to authorize a “superwaiver” from the rules of many federal assistance programs, including public housing, as embodied in House of Representatives bill H.R. 4 and to oppose its inclusion within Senate bill S.1443, which would reauthorize the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families program.
Items.MatterName: Oppose President Bush's proposal to authorize a "superwaiver" from the rules of many federal assistance programs.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting enactment of New York State Assembly Bill A.4297-B, a bill to amend the Public Service Law and Public Authorities Law in relation to the duties of public utilities in maintaining safe and efficient equipment.
Items.MatterName: Duties of public utilities in maintaining safe and efficient equipment. (A.4297-B)

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State legislature to take swift action to pass legislation that would require courts in New York State to advise defendants facing felony, misdemeanor or violation charges that a plea of guilty may result in deportation, exclusion from admission or denial of naturalization and that would provide real remedies for defendants if advisement does not occur.
Items.MatterName: Amending Criminal Procedure Law

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the removal of graffiti from commercial and residential buildings, and in relation to establishing a process whereby the city may clean graffiti from these buildings.
Items.MatterName: Imposing a fine against the owners of commercial buildings and residential buildings of six or more units who do not remove graffiti from their premises.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York City Department of Transportation to place speed humps on public streets surrounding the entrances and exits of all New York City public schools.
Items.MatterName: DOT to place speed humps on public streets surrounding the entrances and exits of all New York City public schools.

Items.Title: Resolution denouncing the Mayor of the City of New York for unilaterally replacing two members of the Panel for Educational Policy who refused to be coerced into voting as instructed by the Mayor.
Items.MatterName: Denouncing the Mayor of the City of New York for unilaterally replacing two members of the Panel for Educational Policy.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to information regarding city contractors.
Items.MatterName: Information regarding city contractors ("re: slave trade, etc.").

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing April as Minority Cancer Awareness Month in the City of New York.
Items.MatterName: Minority Cancer Awareness Month, April

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to conduct an oversight hearing regarding the lack of black male enrollment in higher education.
Items.MatterName: Oversight hearing regarding the lack of black male enrollment in higher education.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Wright, A.1464-A, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Manhattan to the person or persons who would have inherited said property from former owner Enola Walker, deceased, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 1902, Lot No. 126 on the tax map for the borough of Manhattan”.
Items.MatterName: In rem, Enola Walker, Manhattan (A.1464-A)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring Medicaid managed care providers that do not provide family planning and reproductive health services as a part of their benefit package to notify eligible persons and enrollees that such services are not provided.
Items.MatterName: Medicaid managed care providers that do not provide family planning and reproductive health services as a part of their benefit package to notify eligible persons and enrollees that such services are not provided.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Fire Department of the City of New York to either develop alternative methods for administering training and medicals such that no ladder or engine company is ever closed or to temporarily staff any ladder or engine company that is closed for training or medicals.
Items.MatterName: Administering training and medicals such that no ladder or engine company is ever closed.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State of New York, the New York State Board of Regents and the New York State Education Department to recognize American Sign Language as a legitimate modern international language and to authorize public and independent institutions of higher education to offer American Sign Language as an academic course of study that will satisfy foreign language requirements at institutions of higher education across the state.
Items.MatterName: Recognize American Sign Language as a legitimate modern international language.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.6190, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.9798, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the New York city employees’ retirement system employed in probation officer positions”.
Items.MatterName: Establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed in probation officer positions (S.6190, A.9798)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.1885, and Assembly Member Straniere, A.4309, “AN ACT to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the application of uniform land use review procedures”.
Items.MatterName: Application of uniform land use review procedures (S.1885, A.4309)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.4472, and Assembly Member Straniere, A.1211, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to designating the official flag of the borough of Staten Island”.
Items.MatterName: Designating the official flag of the borough of Staten Island (S.4472, A.1211)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Benjamin, A.9934, “AN ACT to amend the agriculture and markets law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to banning dangerous dogs from certain homes with children”.
Items.MatterName: Banning dangerous dogs from certain homes with children (A.9934)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Benjamin, A.10080, “AN ACT to amend the agriculture and markets law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring dangerous dogs to be registered and increasing the registration fees”.
Items.MatterName: Requiring dangerous dogs to be registered and increasing the registration fees (A.10080)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senators Dilan, Brown, Diaz, Gonzalez, Hassell-Thompson, Krueger, Onorato, Parker, Sabini, Sampson, A. Smith and M. Smith, S.6180, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the registration of property and designation of mailing address”.
Items.MatterName: Registration of property and designation of mailing address (S.6180)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.6223, and Assembly Member Colton, A.9810, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the retirement and social security law, in relation to including a twenty-five year retirement program for members of the New York city employees’ retirement system employed by the police department of the city of New York or by the office of the chief medical examiner of such city in the title evidence and property control specialist who are subject to articles 11 and 15 of the retirement and social security law”.
Items.MatterName: Including a twenty-five year retirement program for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed by the police department (S.6223, A.9810)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Stavisky, Brown, Hassell-Thompson, Lachman, Onorato, Parker, Sampson and Smith, S.2126-A, and Assembly Members Cohen, Markey, Seddio, Cook and Pheffer, et al, A.772-A, “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to civil liability of vehicle owners for maximum speed limit violations and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof”.
Items.MatterName: Civil liability of vehicle owners for maximum speed limit violations  (S.2126-A, A.772-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Wright, A.1465, “AN ACT to amend the parks, recreation and historic preservation law, in relation to vacating a trust”.
Items.MatterName: Vacating a trust (A.1465)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.6430, and Assembly Members Grannis, McLaughlin, Dinowitz, Grodenchik, Lafayette, Bing, Gianaris, O’Donnell, Weprin and Perry, et al, A.9610-A, “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to partial abatement of real property taxes”.
Items.MatterName: Partial abatement of real property taxes (S.6430, A.9610-A)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring quality based selection procurement for architectural and engineering services by city agencies.
Items.MatterName: Architectural and Engineering Services

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority and its subsidiaries to stop the practice of leasing advertising space to businesses providing payday loan services, and in the alternative, calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to require payday loan companies to disclose pertinent information in their advertisements.
Items.MatterName: MTA and its subsidiaries to stop the practice of leasing advertising space to businesses providing payday loan services.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to amend Megan’s Law to mandate community notification regarding sex offenders and to require local law enforcement to provide education to the public regarding such notification.
Items.MatterName: Amend Megan's Law to mandate community notification regarding sex offenders.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to the imposition of a real property tax surcharge on certain class one properties.
Items.MatterName: Imposition of a real property tax surcharge on certain class one properties.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the sale of tax liens.
Items.MatterName: Sale of tax liens

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to renaming a portion of Jamaica Avenue in the Borough of Queens, so that it shall hereafter be known as Jericho Turnpike, and to amending the official map of the city of New York accordingly.
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Jericho Turnpike

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt S. 5329 and A. 8301, also known as “Timothy’s Law,” which would provide New Yorkers with fair insurance treatment for mental health and chemical dependency services.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.MatterName: "Timothy's Law," which would provide New Yorkers with fair insurance treatment for mental health and chemical dependency services. (S.5329/A.8301)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting housing discrimination against actual or perceived victims of domestic violence, sex offenses or stalking.
Items.MatterName: Housing discrimination against actual or perceived victims of domestic violence, sex offenses or stalking.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to designating a larger percentage of NYPD traffic enforcement personnel to the enforcement of the Department of Transportation’s designated truck routes.
Items.MatterName: Designating a larger percentage of NYPD traffic enforcement personnel to the enforcement of the DOT's designated truck routes.

Items.MinutesNote:
Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Miller), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Thursday, April 1, 2004.

VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Miller) made the following announcements

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda

By Council Member Nelson:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 040128 PPK shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Kings Highway Public Parking, Brooklyn (C040128PPK)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Nelson:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. 040129 ZSK shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Kings Highway Public Parking, Brooklyn (C040129ZSK)

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
